intro: Geissanthus floccosus, commonly known as the woolly bellflower, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or mountainous terrain. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes other bellflowers. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
